description: A calixTrapALARM is sent when an event on a C7 entity causes a standing
condition and has immediate or potential impact on the operation or
performance of the entity.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapALARM CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmTransition i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmSeverity i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmType i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSrvEffect i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondDescr s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapLocation i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr i 9999

description: C7 Object AID (as per TL1 interface)
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid

description: This enumeration identifies if a subsystem wishes to set or clear
a fault.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmTransition

description: Indicates the alarm severity (Minor, Major...) of an Alarm.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmSeverity

description: Used to indicate the condition type (low battery, Los, Ais, etc) of a
specific entity within the system.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapAlarmType

description: Indicates if the Alarm is Service Affecting or not
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSrvEffect

description: This paramter is a textual description of the condition.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondDescr

description: Identifies which end (near, end) is reporting.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapLocation

description: Object Descriptor Object Type.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass

description: ifIndex of the Slot-Port emitting the Trap in Shelf.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex

description: Trap Serial Number.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr

description: A calixTrapTCAEVENT is sent when an event on a C7 entity causes a TCA
transient condition, not judged to be of the same severity as ALARM .
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTCAEVENT CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondType i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondState i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondDescr s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapLocation i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapMonValue i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapThLevel i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTmPeriod i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr i 9999

description: C7 Object AID (as per TL1 interface)
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid

description: Used to indicate the condition type (low battery, Los, Ais, etc) of a
specific entity within the system.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondType

description: Indicates the state of the condition (TL1 calls it 'CondEffect' that is
not clear, and that gets confused with ServiceEffect)
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondState

description: This paramter is a textual description of the condition.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapCondDescr

description: Identifies which end (near, end) is reporting.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapLocation

description: This parameter is the measured value of a monitored parameter
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapMonValue

description: This parameter is the threshold level for the monitored parameter.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapThLevel

description: This indicates the period of time that the PM threshold values apply
to.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTmPeriod

description: Object Descriptor Object Type.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass

description: ifIndex of the Slot-Port emitting the Trap in Shelf.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex

description: Trap Serial Number.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr

description: A calixRestoreEvent trap is sent when an entity is autonomously
restored to service.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapRESTORE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjState s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr i 9999

description: C7 Object AID (as per TL1 interface)
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid

description: C7 Service State Model.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjState

description: Object Descriptor Object Type.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass

description: ifIndex of the Slot-Port emitting the Trap in Shelf.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex

description: Trap Serial Number.
variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr

description: A calixRemoveEvent trap is sent when an entity is autonomously
removed from service.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapREMOVE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapTl1Aid s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjState s EXAMPLE CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjClass i 1 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapObjIndex i 9999 CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr i 9999

variables.name: CALIX-TRAP-MIB::calixTrapSerialNr

description: A calixTrapEVENT is sent when an event on a C7 entity causes a non-TCA
transient condition, not judged to be of the same severity as ALARM .
